input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE FOR ROADS ASTRA - DEPARTMENT OF ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE-EAST - F3 ZOFINGEN. Summary: N02, Second Gotthard Tube (2Tg Röhre Nord and Airolo Tunnel) and N02 Rehabilitation of the First Gotthard Tube (1Tg Röhre Süd), Bsa-Los 2004 - Optische Leiteinrichtung. Description: In order to enable the renovation of the existing - around 17 km long - Gotthard road tunnel, the Federal Council, Parliament and the population have decided to build a second tube. The BSA equipment of the second tube, referred to as tube north, will take place between 2027 and 2030, partly parallel to the completion of the structural work. Parallel to the north tube, the Galleria di Airolo (GdA) with a length of around 1 km is also being built, which is an integral part of the Gotthard system forms. The GdA will be equipped with modern lighting systems, security systems and centralized control, in accordance with ASTRA specifications. Main CPV: 34993100 Tunnel lighting. Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-02-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Parallel to the north tube, the Galleria di Airolo (GdA) with a length of around 1 km is also being built, which is an integral part of the Gotthard system forms. The GdA will be equipped with modern lighting systems, security systems and centralized control, in accordance with ASTRA specifications. Main CPV: 34993100 Tunnel lighting

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: TERMINAL COMBINÉ MONTHEY SA. Summary: Concession for the Operation of the Monthey Combined Rail-Road Terminal. Description: The Municipality of Monthey and the Monthey chemical site are collaborating for the development of a combined rail-road terminal through the company TCM SA. This terminal will be located in close proximity to one of Switzerland's largest chemical sites. The Monthey rail-road terminal is part of the territorial planning of Switzerland and the cantons of Vaud and Valais. As such, it will be an integral part of the future network of regional rail-road terminals in Switzerland. The Chablais region (cantons of Valais and Vaud) is a highly dynamic industrial area in western Switzerland, crossed by the Simplon line of the Swiss Federal Railways (SBB/CFF/FFS) and by the A9 motorway. The Bex motorway exit ist located less than 2 km from the future infrastructure. These transport links provide rapid access to northern Italy and to the rest of Switzerland. The construction of the Monthey combined rail-road terminal is subsidised by the Swiss Confederation. For this reason, non-discriminatory access to the terminal must be guaranteed to all customers. TCM SA is responsible for building the terminal and granting a concession for its operation. Preliminary work on the construction of the terminal has begun. The main elements of the Monthey combined rail-road Terminal include: • A storage area of approximately 8,000 m², allowing for the storage of 768 TEU containers across 3 levels, including a separate area for 288 containers of hazardous materials, and two storage lanes for mobile boxes .... Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: ENERGY WATER BERN. Summary: Ebp-555_Procurement of Vehicles. Description: This tender will be used to procure commercial vehicles and passenger vehicles (cars) in various categories. The procurement item also includes services such as registration of the vehicles, short training upon handover, and maintenance for at least 5 years (service package), replacement vehicles as needed and a warranty period of at least 5 years. The vehicles to be procured will be used primarily in urban areas (stop and go) and for commuting to work during on-call operations. The vehicles are purchased by ewb (not leased) and are intended to be one Have a useful life of at least five (5) years. The charging infrastructure for electric vehicles is excluded from this tender. The lots listed in section 6.6 of the specifications will be advertised. There will be at least one contractual partner (= 1 contractual partner for all 3 lots), or We are looking for up to a maximum of three (3) contractual partners (i.e. one contractual partner per lot with all vehicle categories required). This means that up to three lots can be offered.<br> Main CPV: 34000000 means of transport and products for transport purposes. Published Date: 2025-11-28. Closing Date: 2026-01-05. Competition: ICB. Bardonnex-Coppet - Lot 183 - Renovation of Ge Ls-S (Id 11654). Description: Lot 183 aims to meet the need for cleaning up the dynamic signaling machines on the N01 and N01E roads around Geneva. It concerns more precisely the renovation of the LS-S level (PLC and local HMI parts) of the four BSA sections of the Geneva bypass :<br> • Plan-les-Ouates (SPLO);<br> • Confignon (SCFG);<br> • Vernier (SVRN);<br> • Airport (SAER).<br> The technical interfaces of lot 183 are to be established with the installations currently in operation initially and then with the new signaling which will be deployed in a second phase.<br> The summary of the work of lot 183 necessary for the implementation of the new LS-S are:<br> • drafting RPH and DAW files;<br> • the reverse engineering of the control and command of the existing signaling installations of the four BSA sections concerned: SPLO, SCFG, SVRN and SAER;<br> • supply and installation LS-S of the four BSA sections concerned;<br> • the supply of LS-S power supply cabinets;<br> • the electrical connections of the cabinets;<br> • the developments of the LS-S for the four BSA sections concerned;<br> • control command of existing signaling with the new LS-S;<br> • there software qualification (monitoring requirements, carrying out platform and site tests);<br> • deployment and on-site production of LS-S in several stages;<br> • carrying out work in technical premises (around 10 technical buildings);<br> • control migration order.... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: REGIONAL TRANSPORT BERN-SOLOTHURN AG (RBS). Summary: New Depot Construction Including Conversion of Batterkinden Station (Groove Rail Switches). Description: The Bern Solothurn RBS regional transport company is planning to build a maintenance and parking facility (depot) in Batterkinden. This new depot will replace the facilities in Solothurn and Worblaufen in the future. The existing Batterkinden train station is located to the east of the planned depot facility. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: TERMINAL COMBINÉ MONTHEY SA. Summary: Concession for the Operation of the Monthey Combined Rail-Road Terminal. Description: The Municipality of Monthey and the Monthey chemical site are collaborating for the development of a combined rail-road terminal through the company TCM SA. This terminal will be located in close proximity to one of Switzerland's largest chemical sites. The Monthey rail-road terminal is part of the territorial planning of Switzerland and the cantons of Vaud and Valais. As such, it will be an integral part of the future network of regional rail-road terminals in Switzerland. The Chablais region (cantons of Valais and Vaud) is a highly dynamic industrial area in western Switzerland, crossed by the Simplon line of the Swiss Federal Railways (SBB/CFF/FFS) and by the A9 motorway. The Bex motorway exit ist located less than 2 km from the future infrastructure. These transport links provide rapid access to northern Italy and to the rest of Switzerland. The construction of the Monthey combined rail-road terminal is subsidised by the Swiss Confederation. For this reason, non-discriminatory access to the terminal must be guaranteed to all customers. TCM SA is responsible for building the terminal and granting a concession for its operation. Preliminary work on the construction of the terminal has begun. The main elements of the Monthey combined rail-road Terminal include: • A storage area of approximately 8,000 m², allowing for the storage of 768 TEU containers across 3 levels, including a separate area for 288 containers of hazardous materials, and two storage lanes for mobile boxes .... Published Date: 2025-10-15. Closing Date: 2025-12-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: TERMINAL COMBINÉ MONTHEY SA. Summary: Concession for the Operation of the Monthey Combined Rail-Road Terminal. Description: The Municipality of Monthey and the Monthey chemical site are collaborating for the development of a combined rail-road terminal through the company TCM SA. This terminal will be located in close proximity to one of Switzerland's largest chemical sites. The Monthey rail-road terminal is part of the territorial planning of Switzerland and the cantons of Vaud and Valais. As such, it will be an integral part of the future network of regional rail-road terminals in Switzerland. The Chablais region (cantons of Valais and Vaud) is a highly dynamic industrial area in western Switzerland, crossed by the Simplon line of the Swiss Federal Railways (SBB/CFF/FFS) and by the A9 motorway. The Bex motorway exit ist located less than 2 km from the future infrastructure. These transport links provide rapid access to northern Italy and to the rest of Switzerland. The construction of the Monthey combined rail-road terminal is subsidised by the Swiss Confederation. For this reason, non-discriminatory access to the terminal must be guaranteed to all customers. TCM SA is responsible for building the terminal and granting a concession for its operation. Preliminary work on the construction of the terminal has begun. The main elements of the Monthey combined rail-road Terminal include: • A storage area of approximately 8,000 m², allowing for the storage of 768 TEU containers across 3 levels, including a separate area for 288 containers of hazardous materials, and two storage lanes for mobile boxes .... Published Date: 2025-09-30. Closing Date: 2025-12-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: TERMINAL COMBINÉ MONTHEY SA. Summary: Concession for the Operation of the Monthey Combined Rail-Road Terminal. Description: The Municipality of Monthey and the Monthey chemical site are collaborating for the development of a combined rail-road terminal through the company TCM SA. This terminal will be located in close proximity to one of Switzerland's largest chemical sites. The Monthey rail-road terminal is part of the territorial planning of Switzerland and the cantons of Vaud and Valais. As such, it will be an integral part of the future network of regional rail-road terminals in Switzerland. The Chablais region (cantons of Valais and Vaud) is a highly dynamic industrial area in western Switzerland, crossed by the Simplon line of the Swiss Federal Railways (SBB/CFF/FFS) and by the A9 motorway. The Bex motorway exit ist located less than 2 km from the future infrastructure. These transport links provide rapid access to northern Italy and to the rest of Switzerland. The construction of the Monthey combined rail-road terminal is subsidised by the Swiss Confederation. For this reason, non-discriminatory access to the terminal must be guaranteed to all customers. TCM SA is responsible for building the terminal and granting a concession for its operation. Preliminary work on the construction of the terminal has begun. The main elements of the Monthey combined rail-road Terminal include: • A storage area of approximately 8,000 m², allowing for the storage of 768 TEU containers across 3 levels, including a separate area for 288 containers of hazardous materials, and two storage lanes for mobile boxes .... Published Date: 2025-09-24. Closing Date: 2025-12-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: Immobilienstadt Zurich (Immo) is a service department of the building department of the city of Zurich and is responsible for the management and facility management of around 1,900 urban real estate. As part of an open tender procedure, service providers are sought for the successive, needs-based provision of transport and logistics services. The aim of the tender is to find one (lot 2 and 3), or several (max. 3 at Los 1) service provider that support the city of Zurich in transport and logistics tasks, especially in the area of ​​moving planning, transport disposition, processing as well as ancillary services, such as intermediate storage, cleaning and furnishings. The surcharge is distributed in different loose (a total of three), which is implemented by the conclusion of framework contracts. Based on this, the client can call up individual orders. However, the service providers are not entitled to a minimum number of individual orders, which is why additional claims for less than the expected orders are excluded. <br> Main CPV: 60000,000 transport and transport services (except for waste transport). Description: FLP competes through public competition procedure the supply of a special machinery, which allows the preventive intervention to the formation of ice on the chain. The deghiacciante car irrews with an anti -cigate substance the chain, hindering the formation of ice for plus days from the application. This machine must have the following essential characteristics:<br> . Employment chain use (1'200 V DC +/ - 25%voltage): the machine must work without touching the contact line;<br> . Employment chain use (1'200 V DC +/ - 25%voltage): The machine has to work without the need to disconnect the tension;<br> . Effectiveness of spraying: the sprinkler pistol and/or spraying nozzles must be able to orient themselves automatically to follow the position of the contact wire in its lateral movements (polygonation) e vertical;<br> . Motorcycle power supply: the machine must be energetically autonomous and independent.<br> The client also identified other preferential technical requirements, which are listed in detail within the "document B - Offer module".<br> The machine must be accompanied by all the necessary documentation, which must also include a maintenance plan that includes:<br> 1) maintenance and daily checks (which performs the operator);<br> 2) maintenance and monthly controls (which performs the operator);<br> 3) Maintenance and annual controls;<br> 4) Maintenance .... input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: PUBLIC TRANSPORT OF THE LAUSANNE REGION ITS. Summary: Mp 2024.10.730 - Supply and Installation of Signage. Description: The current signage of the TL network, set up between the 1990s and 2000s, has only benefited from occasional adaptations since its last major overhaul in 2008, made to integrate the M2 metro. It is not a homogeneous system covering all the modes of transport, thiswhich complicates the orientation of users, in particular in multimodal exchange poles such as Flon, Bel-Air and St-Francois. <br> The absence of coherent and updated signage negatively impacts the accessibility, inclusiveness and readability of the transport offer, reducing its attractivenessand the user experience. <br> The introduction of a new tram line by 2026 is an opportunity to modernize and harmonize signage on the scale of the whole TL network. <br> In this context, the present call for tenders relates to the supply and installation of elements of elementsSignage (shutdown name panels, connection indications, arrows, etc.), as well as on associated services: printing, installation, disassembly, recycling and updating of the supports. <br> The market is structured in 3 lots: <br> - lot 1: Road / tram signage <br> - Lot 2: Metrum signage (M1,M2) <br> - Lot 3: Signage R20/LEB <br> For the 3 lots, the expected services include supply, production, printing, installation, disassembly, recycling or elimination, as well as maintenance/update of the whole network signage. <br> Le Lot 1compre.... Published Date: 2025-04-25. Closing Date: 2025-06-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
